div.span: As a community we educate, nurture, and challenge all students to be successful, enthusiastic, and lifelong learners who creatively explore, effectively apply, and share knowledge as responsible participants in an ever changing world.

div.p: Your Custom Text Here

div.h2: As a community we educate, nurture, and challenge all students to be successful, enthusiastic, and lifelong learners who creatively explore, effectively apply, and share knowledge as responsible participants in an ever changing world.

div.p:
Join Zoom Meeting
https://zoom.us/j/9822466859?pwd=RzQxKzA3QklHZG1Kb0RsZGNhTW4xQT09
Meeting ID: 982 246 6859 Password: 252191
Contact tbutterfield@lafayetteregional if you have difficulties signing in.

h2.strong: Click to access your MyMealtime account:

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: The Weekend backpack program is separate from our lunch program, so if you are not receiving a weekend backpack and have found you need this, please email tbutterfield@lafayetteregional.org and we'll get things rolling. We can tell you about local food pantries as well. The Weekend backpack program is filled with food for the kids and isn't enough for the whole family.

We are working on a way families can donate to our weekend backpack program but haven't quite figured out the protocol for doing it at our closed school while we are in a sort of stay home time. We'll keep you posted.
If anyone is interested please reach out to me at tbutterfield@lafayeteregional.org.
Hi all -

We are going to do two week of orders on this survey. Please try to get it back to me via the survey or an email by tomorrow, Tuesday, April 14 by the end of the day. I tried to get some orders switched around to accommodate what you guys are asking for this, but I apologize if you don't always get exactly what you want. Believe me, we're trying.

We will be delivering meals the week of Spring Break even though remote learning will be taking a break. Ms. Phyllis is jazzing things up and will be offering some of her "hot" lunch specialties that you can reheat at home. See below for Spaghetti & Meatballs, Chicken Nuggets, and Nachos on Wednesday, Thursday Friday of break week. We will deliver to you whether we receive a new order from you or not, unless you will not be there. We figured we are all stuck here so we might as well keep delivering.

p.em: above to place your order for 4/20-5/1/2020!

div.p: THIS IS A BIG HELP TO OUR FOOD SERVICE PROGRAM. During the designated Emergency Period, all meals will be paid to our lunch program through the $2+ trillion bill that was recently passed. This is a great way to support Ms. Phyllis and our program, rather than the program losing money because of all the lost meals from being out of school. Thanks so much.

There has been issues with the Google form on the website so please feel free to just email me your kid(s) choice(s) for the week. Sometimes technology isn't the most efficient. We're working on getting it to be more user friendly, so if it gets going feel free to use it and I will confirm with an email that I received your order.

As we mentioned before, we know this is hitting everyone differently and we want to help if we can. for many families, applying for free and reduced meals will likely qualify you for free or reduced meals now. Because we do not know how long the "Free For All Program" will last, if you apply now and qualify, your family will be all set to receive free meals when this program stops until the end of the school year and will give you a chance to catch up financially. FOR NOW EVERYONE IS FREE, we just want anyone who can, to receive free meals after this stops. You can take a picture of the application, front and back, and email it to me. If I have any questions, I'll let you know.
Sending virtual hugs to everyone. Really miss you all.
~ Toni

div.h2: Principal’s Report to the School Board
div.p: Each month, Mr. Johnk reports to the School Board about the prior month's activities at Lafayette. His reports include everything from test scores to moments from "Kids Say the Darnedest Things!" He informs the board members about what is going on in all the classrooms as well as schoolwide initiatives. We have a history of these reports for you to see all the cool things that have happened and are still happening at Lafayette Regional School everyday.

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.p: Lafayette Regional School creates a culture of educational excellence by providing challenging, engaging, and personalized learning experiences for all students. Deep learning develops through the implementation of standards-based and research-based instructional models as evidenced by academic growth of at least one year. Critical thinking, communication, collaboration, and creativity cultivate intrinsically motivated students who believe they can learn. Partnerships with supportive parents and community members model social awareness and civic responsibility.

div.h2: Notes from the Office, A Lafayette newsletter
div.p: Find everything from A-Z in our weekly Lafayette Newsletter!

div.h2: REMOTE TEACHERS & LEARNERS DOING THEIR THING…
